the middle of your pregnancy 
than at other times. This is not 
a problem, but may make you 
feel light-headed if you get up 
quickly. Talk to your midwife if 
you are concerned.
Checking your baby’s 
development and 
wellbeing
At each antenatal appointment 
from 25 weeks, your midwife 
or doctor should check your 
baby’s growth. To do this, 
they will measure the distance 
from the top of your uterus to 
your pubic bone, or measure 
the baby using an ultrasound
